title: New Product Introduction Engineer - FSR
content:
New Product Introduction Engineer - FSR, Corona, CA
Write programs/code for CNC’s in Metal shop, Mill (wood shop), and Buff and Polish departments. Design fixtures for current and upcoming models. Create documentation for Mill processes (i.e., work instructions, travelers, spec sheets, visual aids). Conduct Bill of Materials and R&D Drawing validations. Review Risks and Constraints of Metalshop & Sub Assembly components. Support Electronics R&D with Amp Builds and fixturing. Assure all project documentation is delivered at the proper project phase. Collaborate with multifunctional teams to assure an effective product launch on time, to quality specifications. Drive problem-solving efforts for new products introductions using SolidWorks, Mastercam, and other CAD/CAM software. Incorporate DFM/PFMEA efforts to assure manufacturability. Configure and set up ANDI and HAAS CNCs for components for guitar manufacturing. Establish processes and procedures through standardized work instructions for Factory Special Runs. Apply suitable technological and quantitative methods and tools to solve practical and management problems. Assist planning department in planning new products (waterfall planning charts) for release to the operations. Analyze the Statistical Process using process capability CPK Studies and Process Characterization. Assist operations in implementing and controlling the new processes designed for Factory Special Run with the help of standardized travelers and necessary documentation. Plan product introductions and material flow to optimize the process. Support process troubleshooting and debugging to find the root cause of production issues. Work with product development on Factory Special Runs, testing and introduction. Develop mechanical design using SolidWorks and CAD to program. Apply advanced analytical and critical thinking skills to evaluate information, solve problems, and make sound decisions in the different areas of project management. Troubleshoot problems and alarms on a CNC mill or lathe (using Haas, Anderson, Fadal, and Brother). Apply project management techniques to identify project scope. (No agencies or phone calls please.)
Requires Bachelor’s degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and 2 years of engineering experience in wood product manufacturing environment.
Must possess 2 years of experience with:

Mechanical design software (including SolidWorks, CAD programming)
Statistical Process Analysis (including Process capability CPK Studies, Process Characterization)
Troubleshooting problems and alarms on a CNC mill or lathe (including Haas, Anderson, Fadal, Brother)
SolidWorks and Mastercam software (or other CAD/CAM software)
Configuring and setting up ANDI and HAAS CNCs for components for guitar manufacturing

Salary:  $60,486-75,000/year

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING STATEMENTS CAREFULLY: The information I've provided on this application is accurate to the best of my knowledge and subject to verification. Any misrepresentation or deliberate omission of fact in my application will be justification for refusal to employ me or for termination of my employment by Fender Musical Instruments Corporation. If employed, I shall sign the non-compete/confidentiality agreement, if applicable, in which I will agree to protect Fender Musical Instruments Corporation's confidential information. If employed, I understand that Fender Musical Instruments Corporation is an "at will" employer, in that employment is terminable at the will of the company or me at any time, with or without notice, and for any lawful reason, or no reason. I understand that, if employed, I must at all times comply with Fender Musical Instruments Corporation's standards of work performance and business conduct. Failure to do so can result in my release without notice or severance pay. I authorize Fender Musical Instruments Corporation to obtain information about me from my previous employers and schools.
